2025-06-05.content: Network Security integration now retains 396 bytes for the GENEVE encapsulation overhead. Consumer networks must use the maximum transmission unit (MTU) size of 8500 bytes or less. Producer networks must use an MTU at least 396 bytes more than the consumer network. For more information, see [GENEVE encapsulation and MTU requirements](https://cloud.google.com/network-security-integration/docs/understand-geneve#geneve-mtu).

summary.title: Network Security: GENEVE Encapsulation Overhead Update
summary.summary: The GENEVE encapsulation overhead has been updated to 396 bytes. Ensure your network's MTU is set appropriately to avoid issues. Consumer networks should use an MTU of 8500 bytes or less, while producer networks need an MTU at least 396 bytes larger than the consumer network's MTU.
